featured.text: By doing so, the they have to work together to explore alternative flock members are able to keep a safe distance routes many times before they finally settle on the between themselves, and thus avoid crashing into most efficient one.
They have evolved social birds and often travel in large flocks.
Meanwhile, fans across the U.S. are flocking to sports shows to have their heroes sign anything from a bat to a box of cereal.
In fact, a visit to a major European city just would not be the same 16 encountering them: bathing in fountains, perching on historic buildings, and flocking in public squares.

definition.zh_def: 一群動物，特別是鳥類或羊，通常一起移動或生活。
definition.en_def: A group of animals, especially birds or sheep, that move or live together.
definition.example: The flock of birds flew gracefully across the sky.
